node.display_long_description:
Celebrate International Space Day on Oculus TV!  Launch interstellar voyages right from your living room, from educational jaunts in our solar system to epic adventures in distant galaxies.  From stepping onboard the International Space Station to experiencing the awe of passing through an air lock, Oculus TV is full of Space content to get your interstellar fix!

Oculus TV is a VR home for the best in immersive entertainment where you’re always at the center of the action. Get access to award-winning interactive stories, as well as immersive TV, animation and photos. Our regularly-updated lineup includes a variety of genres including sci-fi, travel, sports and more.

nodes.title: Happy Mother’s Day!
nodes.body_text: Enjoy these heartwarming stories and moments about our mothers and motherhood in this touching series of beautifully animated experiences in Quill Theater and Oculus TV!

nodes.title: Celebrate International Space Day
nodes.body_text: Be inspired in the pursuit of knowledge and progress throughout the vast unknown: outer space.  Launch interstellar voyages right from your living room, from educational jaunts in our solar system to epic adventures in distant galaxies.  From stepping onboard the International Space Station to experiencing the awe of passing through an air lock, Oculus TV is full of Space content to get your interstellar fix!

node.reviewDescription:
Idk why this has such low ratings. It’s definitely not perfect. It’s not even really an app. It’s more a display with videos you enter. There’s a lot of crap for sure. A lot of earlier content was recorded with bad quality cameras. But, there’s also a lot of cool stuff. I mean, big cat rescue, that b*^ch carol baskin has videos where you’re the POV of a tiger’s food and you’re looking up at this amazing animal eating (you). There’s cool informative stuff about the pyramids, there’s videos about what it’s like in jail. There’s stuff underwater, there’s flying videos. Theres one where you’re the nuke that’s dropped on Japan and it brought me to tears as I realized the reality of the drop. There’s meditations (they suck). There’s creator made art content. There free interactive games. “Notes on blindness” for example. Overall I’m really happy to have this on the quest2. It’s a wonderful way to see the world and chill out before bed. Give it a thorough search before writing it off. 

In the future I’m looking forward to environments and theaters instead of just putting you facing a screen in space. I really do love that this is a thing and it deserves a higher rating imo.
